section.title: Features added and issues fixed in this release
section.para: Following is a list of new and noteworthy features and bug fixes in this release:

listitem.para: JBIDE-7025: OpenOn support has been added for the beans.xml editor. OpenOn support allows you to easily navigate around your project without the use of the Package Explorer or Project Explorer. This is achieved by using the class and method names in your code as links to those code segments.
JBIDE-6998: The Weld project extensions (beans_1_1.xsd) are now supported by the beans.xml editor.

JBIDE-6983: The beans.xml editor now correctly supports elements in other namespaces. This has been achieved by supporting any child element of the <beans> root element and providing dynamic extentions to beans.xml in order to support different namespaces.

JBIDE-6742 and JBIDE-6743: Error messages have been rewritten to clarify the error that occured. For example, the error message Session bean with a parameterized bean class declares any scope other than @Dependent has been rewritten to say Session bean with a parameterized bean class must have @Dependent scope. For a list of all error messages affected view the associated JIRAs.

JBIDE-6728: Each field injection point that includes an Event type is now provided with a default bean. For example the injection field @Inject @Any @Tame @Role("Master") Event tamingEvent will now have a bean for injection.

JBIDE-6704: It is now possible to enable and disable the CDI validator at the project level. To enable project validator settings navigate to ProjectPropertiesCDI SettingsValidatorEnable project specific settings.

JBIDE-6642: Validation has been added to ensure that @Stereotype annotation has the following annotation components: @Target({TYPE, METHOD, FIELD}), @Target(TYPE), @Target(METHOD), @Target(FIELD) or @Target({METHOD, FIELD}), and @Retention(RUNTIME).
JBIDE-6641 and JBIDE-6640: The OpenOn menu for injection points has been upgraded to present more information concerning eligible beans and indicates the class or classes that will be injected.
JBIDE-6639: Validation has been added to ensure that @Scope and @NormalScope annotation have the following annotation components: @Target({TYPE, METHOD, FIELD}) and @Retention(RUNTIME).

JBIDE-6637: Validation has been added to ensure that @Qualifier and @NormalScope annotation have the following annotation components: @Target({METHOD, FIELD, PARAMETER, TYPE}) and @Retention(RUNTIME).

JBIDE-6636: Errors in the @Typed annotation applied to the Bean class, Producer method and the Producer field were not reported on. If @Typed annotation errors are present in these circumstances, the errors are now reported to the user.

JBIDE-6635: A bug existed that would ignore the decorator of a class and take a user straight to the bean when choosing the Open Injected Class option. This issue has been corrected by expanding on the list of options to choose from. New options include Open Decorator NAME and Open Interceptor NAME
JBIDE-6837: Deltacloud tooling has been added for this release.

JBIDE-7193: New optional parameters ruleMultithreadEvaluation and ruleMaxThreads have been added to the BussinessRulesProcessor class. ruleMultithreadEvaluation enables or disables KnowledgeBase partitioning. ruleMaxThreads defines the numer of threads to use when KnowledgeBase partitioning is enabled. The default values for these parameters is null, disabling them by default.
JBIDE-7235: The ESB validator has been extended to cover the BussinessRulesProcessor class. This ensures that only one ruleSet is specified by the BussinessRulesProcessor, inhibiting conflicts.

JBIDE-7055: Eclipse Helios provides a new view called the Annotation Properties view that is focused on JAXB and JAX-WS annotations. The new view is now extended with support for ESB annotations for action definitions.

To open the new Annotation Properties view, navigate to WindowShow ViewOtherJAX-WSAnnotation Properties and clicking OK. The view can be filtered to display only ESB annotations by selecting the Filters option from the Annotation Properties view menu and then selecting all annotation categories except for JBoss ESB and clicking OK.
JBIDE-6908: Support for ESB 4.9 has been added to the ESB project editor.

JBIDE-6758: An existing service element without a child security element would not be be able to have the security element added through the user interface. To this issue, each service element now has a security element and a subsequent Security form automatically attached in the ESB editor. The security element can safely be deleted from the service element code without the Security form being removed in the ESB editor. This ensures that if a user wishes to re-add a security element at a later stage, the functionality will exist to do so within the user interface.
JBIDE-7092: Support has been added for the Google Web Toolkit (GWT) Designer. To use this functionality do the following:
Install the GWT Designer from http://dl.google.com/eclipse/inst/d2gwt/latest
Create a dynamic web project and active the GWT facet
Build the included GWT examples
Right-click on Gwt_jboss.java and choose Open withWindowBuilder Editor from the menu
Switch the editor to the Designer tab

JBIDE-6988: Console configuration would not take into account the schema and catalog being specified for a JPA project. This meant that if two schemas existed for one databse when a user opened the created console confitguration, it would error indicating there was two database schemas. The expected result is that the schema that has been set for the project would be used.

Expected behavior has been implemented by setting a default_schema property in the properties for the project as if this was being set in the hibernate.properties file. However properties in the hibernate.properties file will overwrite project properties.
JBIDE-6974: Support for comments in the HQL editor has been added for this release. Comments are annotated with -- at the beginning of each comment line.

JBIDE-6727: When a JPA project is created with Hibernate a console configuration is automatically created for it. However if a Hibernate JPA project did not have a console configuration associated with it an exception would occur due to the tooling assuming a console configuration existed. To avoid this situation, Hibernate JPA projects are now tested for an associated console configuration. If a console configuration is not found an error will appear in the Problems view.

JBIDE-6703: The QueryExporter has been added to the exporters for use in Hibernate code generation configurations. This is accomplished by allowing all Ant export tasks to be executed from the user interface.

JBIDE-6686: An error existed where the Hibernate platform to be used was not filtered based on the version of JPA being used. This meant that selecting the JPA version to use would present all Hibernate platforms to the user, with indistinct names. This issue has been corrected by only displaying the Hibernate platform that corresponds to the specified JPA version, and renaming these platforms for easier identification.

JBIDE-7147: The validators create a marker for each problem found when conducting validation. An issue would arise where system performance would be drammatically decreased when an excesive amount of problems were discovered and subsequently marked. To ensure a system does not receive a performance hit, the Validator preferences screen now includes the ability to set the maximum number of problems reported per file. If there are more issues in a file than the maximum number to be reported, once the reported issues are corrected the others will be reported in subsequent validation attempts.

JBIDE-7086: MyFaces uses the library myfaces-metadata.xml to enable tag auto-completion, a plug-in that was not supported. MyFaces plug-in library support has been added, allowing for MyFaces tag auto-completion.

JBIDE-7021: Low performance issues existed for validation of web pages. Performance issues were caused by the XHTML syntax validator performing to slow if a DOCTYPE was not declared at the top of XHTML files, the PageContextFactory.createPageContext method created a SSE model for non-facelet pages, if a page contained Expression Language (EL) errors or warnings, a memory leak appeared in the PageContextFactory.getSheetForTagAttribute method by registerting ExtendedLinkElementAdapter and never releasing the memory allocated to it. These issues have been addressed in this release and the PageContextFactory class has been removed from the resource listeners since resources can be modified without changing their context in other places apart from the included validators.
JBIDE-6816: A template page for RichFaces has been added to the list of available XHTML templates.
JBIDE-6815: A template page has been added that does not incorporate Facelets.

JBIDE-6973: A HTTP poller has been added for JBoss servers to detect if the server is running. This added feature will be useful for remote and local servers, being less resource-intensive than polling with JMX.

JBIDE-6796: Launch configuration of the server can now be altered to perform different tasks based on the server mode; sample modes include local and Remote System Explorer (RSE). This added functionality has been achieved by separating launch behaviour into seperate classes.
JBIDE-6707: The ability to Explore a specific resource on a server has now been expanded to encapsulate the entire server, allowing the deploy directory to be explored.

JBIDE-6877 and JBIDE-6875: When a user writes code for the Seam component that won't compile, new quick fixes are now presented through annotations. Quick fixes include the ability to quickly add a Name annotation to the class and delete a Create, Unwrap or Observer annotation from the method.
JBIDE-6876: The quick fix annotation suggestions for the Destroy method have been updated to remove Set Seam properties option. This option should not have been presented in this situation.
JBIDE-6874: Quick fix now offers to delete any Remove annotation.
JBIDE-6873 and JBIDE-6871: For Scope annotation, quick fix now offers to change a component's scope.
JBIDE-6870: Quick fix now offers to create a new method with Remove or Destroy annotation. These annotations are also offered as additions to existing methods.
JBIDE-6869: Quick fix now offers to rename a component if it is a duplicate and to delete Name annotation.

JBIDE-7059: XulRunner (XR) has become an optional install of the Visual Page Editor. This decision has meant that the buttons of the Visual Page Editor plug-in have been moved to be apart of the Eclipse icon bar.

JBIDE-6981: Functionality has been added that provides a drop-down menu in the tag breadcrumbs that enables easy selection of any child element to the selected tag. If there are no children to be expanded, the last tag will remain highlighted.
JBIDE-6805: New templates have been added, supporting most docbook tags.
JBIDE-6721 and JBIDE-6711: Spring support has been added to the Visual Page Editor through the addition of a new plug-in. The plug-in is available as org.jboss.tools.vpe.spring.
JBIDE-7106: Annotations have been added for JAX-RS (Java API for RESTful Web Services). This addition has been accomplished by modifying the Annotation Properties view.

JBIDE-6904: A new wizard is available for creating JAX-WS and JAX-RS services from annotated class files. If the classes do not exist upon creation of the services, they will be created during service creation, the same as if the user had used the Create a Sample Web Service or Create a Sample RESTful Web Service wizards.

JBIDE-6851 and JBIDE-6850: A new feature has been added providing the ability to read Web Service Definition Language (WSDL) over HTTPS. This ensures that secured GET and POST methods are usable and will not produce a com.sun.xml.internal.ws.wsdl.parser.InaccessibleWSDLException: 2 counts of InaccessibleWSDLException exception.

JBIDE-6797: A new Options menu item has been added to the Web Services interface for JAX-RS. The Options menu item allows a user to test RESTful web services for allowed HTTP methods such as POST and GET. Results from the Options operation are viewable in the Response Headers list.

JBIDE-6753: In JBoss Application Server 6 no entries are required in the web.xml file, however entries remain mandatory for earlier releases. To reflect this upgrade, the Generate a Sample RESTful Web Service wizard now contains a checkbox to Update web.xml. By default the update option is enabled. If a user is aware that JBoss Application Server 6 is being utilized and they do not wish to update the web.xml file, this checkbox can be unchecked.

JBIDE-6660: A bug existed in the Web Services tooling such that when a user attempted to connect with a password protected URL (for example, a deltacloud) a dialog would appear requesting a username and password combination, however when the information was submitted it would not persist; this ensured the user would be asked for login details continually. This issue has been fixed by the creation of a new dialog that remembers the authentication information last used, however login information is not currently persisted between sessions (for example, closing and then reopening a workbench).
